meanings.definition: The state or quality of being sickly.
meanings.sent1: Her constant coughing and pale skin showed her sicklinesses.
meanings.sent2: The doctor recommended more rest to improve her sicklinesses.
meanings.sent3: Despite his sicklinesses, he always had a positive attitude.
meanings.sent4: The sicklinesses of the old house were evident in its peeling paint and creaky floors.
meanings.sent5: The sicklinesses of the plant were due to overwatering and lack of sunlight.

meanings.definition: The tendency to become sick easily.
meanings.sent1: His sicklinesses meant he caught every cold that went around.
meanings.sent2: The child's sicklinesses worried her parents, so they ensured she ate well.
meanings.sent3: Despite his sicklinesses, he always managed to bounce back quickly.
meanings.sent4: The sicklinesses of the town were evident in the high number of flu cases each year.
meanings.sent5: Her sicklinesses made her immune system weaker than others.
